summary: This document is an email chain from May 2022 between FBI Victim Services Division personnel and a Special Agent regarding logistical planning for victim support at Ghislaine Maxwell's scheduled sentencing hearing on June 28, 2022. The emails discuss obtaining approval from the AUSA (Assistant United States Attorney) to have a crisis response canine handler present in the courtroom.

persons.name: DSW
persons.role: Victim Services Coordinator, FBI Victim Services Division
persons.context: Corresponds about the procedural steps needed to get a crisis response canine handler approved for the courtroom, mentions having a pre-existing motion for the judge.

connections.description: Collaborating via email on logistics for victim services at the Maxwell sentencing, with MS requesting information and DSW providing procedural guidance.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Sentencing Hearing
events.description: Scheduled sentencing for Ghislaine Maxwell at 11am. FBI Victim Services personnel are planning to have a crisis response canine handler present to assist victims.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's sentencing was scheduled for June 28, 2022, at 11am.
The FBI Victim Services Division was actively planning to provide a crisis response canine handler to assist victims in the courtroom during the sentencing.
The plan required approval from the AUSA (Assistant U.S. Attorney) and a motion to be presented to the judge for concurrence.
The email chain shows inter-agency coordination (FBI New York Field Office and FBI Victim Services Division) for victim support at a high-profile sentencing.
